alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Houston County through 515 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cottonwood, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Dothan, Taylor, Ashford, Rehobeth, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Memphis, Pansey, Crosby, Grangeburg, Garretts Crossroads, Lovetown, Wilson Mill, Sealy Springs, Olympia Spa Resort, Keytons and Hodgesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia.
